content.text: Hi, I want to source an item. Candle making material - molds wicks colours fragrances waxes jars

content.thinking: Candle making supplies - multiple items. Show expertise, give value first.

content.text:
Great choice — candle making supplies are one of the most popular categories we source from China. Here's a quick overview:

- *Silicone molds:* $0.30-2/pc depending on size and detail
- *Cotton wicks:* $0.01-0.05/pc (pre-tabbed costs a bit more)
- *Dye chips/liquid colorants:* $1-5/kg
- *Fragrance oils:* $3-10/kg depending on blend
- *Soy/paraffin wax:* $1-3/kg
- *Glass jars with lids:* $0.30-1.50/pc depending on size

Are you looking to source all of these together as a bundle, or is there one item you need in the largest quantity? (This helps me match you with the right supplier — some factories specialize in wax+fragrance, others in glass+molds.)

Brother i m new beginner and student. May i cannot purchase in bulk but 25 to 35 wicks some candle jars like 10 to 15 different molds. Candle fragrances of approx 20 to 30 ml of per fragrances. And candle dye colours

content.thinking:
Small quantities - need to do budget math and exit gracefully.

25-35 wicks (~$1), 10-15 jars (~$5-15), few molds, small fragrance bottles, some dye. Total order maybe $30-50 max. Way below any MOQ for international sourcing. Shipping alone would cost more than the products.

content.text:
I appreciate you being upfront — that really helps!

Let me be honest with you though. For these quantities (25-35 wicks, 10-15 jars, small fragrance bottles), international sourcing from China wouldn't make sense — the *shipping alone* would cost more than the products themselves.

For a beginner candle-making kit at this scale, you'd get *much better pricing* buying locally or from platforms like Amazon, Etsy, or even AliExpress (which handles small qty shipping).

When your candle business grows and you're ready for larger orders (100+ jars, bulk wax by the kg, etc.), we'd love to help you source directly from factories — that's where the real savings kick in. Feel free to reach out anytime!
Can u tell me minimum amount you export. Nd please do you export scoops order material

Our minimum order typically works out to around *$500-1,000 USD* to make international shipping worthwhile. Below that, freight costs eat up your savings.

For candle supplies specifically:
- *Wicks:* 500+ pcs
- *Jars:* 100+ pcs
- *Molds:* 50+ pcs
- *Wax:* 25-50 kg
- *Fragrance oils:* 1-5 kg per scent
- *Dye:* 500g-1kg per color

At these quantities, you'd be paying a fraction of local retail prices.

Regarding your question — could you clarify what you mean by *"scoops order material"*? Do you mean ice cream scoops, protein powder scoops, or something else? (Want to make sure I point you in the right direction!)
